duck: Architectural conservation - Architectural conservation describes the process through which the material, historical, and design integrity of mankind's built heritage are prolonged through carefully planned interventions.
Wildlife management, multidisciplinary practices, including conservation of species and their habitats
Conservation organization typically an environmental organization
Conservation
http://www.merriam-webster.com/dictionary/conservation
conservation definition: a careful preservation and protection of something; '''especially'''.
Marine conservation, the protection and preservation of ecosystems in oceans and seas
Conservation movement, to protect animals, fungi, plants and their habitats
Conserved sequence - "similar or identical sequences that may occur within nucleic acid sequences, protein sequences, protein structures or polymeric carbohydrates."
Conservation genetics - "an interdisciplinary science that aims to apply genetic methods to the conservation and restoration of biodiversity."
Conservation (ethic), an ethic of resource use, allocation, and protection, especially of the natural environment
Soil conservation, management strategies for prevention of soil being eroded from the earth’s surface or becoming chemically altered
Wildlife conservation, protecting endangered species and their habitat
Energy conservation, the reduction of energy consumption
Conservation of energy - The law of conservation of energy, first formulated in the nineteenth century, is a law of physics.
Conservation finance, the practice of raising and managing capital to support land, water, and resource conservation
Conservationist, a person who advocates for conservation of animals, fungi, plants and their habitats

Photograph conservation - Photograph conservation is the study of the physical care and treatment of photographic materials, including an in-depth understanding of how photographs are made, and the causes and prevention ...
Wetland conservation, protecting wetlands to conserve their ecological processes
Merriam-Webster
Conservation authority (Canada) - A conservation authority is a local, community-based environmental agency based in Ontario, Canada.
Conserved name (Latin nomen conservandum), a scientific name with specific nomenclatural protection.
Conservation biology, the science of the protection and management of biodiversity
Conservation-restoration, art conservation, protecting works of art, preservation of cultural resources
Water conservation, reducing the use of water to protect the environment
Conservation laws, a set of laws in physics
Habitat conservation, a land management practice that seeks to conserve, protect and restore, habitat areas for wild animals, fungi and plants
Conservation (psychology), learning development of logical thinking, according to Jean Piaget

milestones: US presidential candidate Dodd applauded by League of Conservation
Fire Fighters Join "TR" Roosevelt Conservation Partnership
New Zealand Department of Conservation leaves Raoul Island, minus one
Great white sharks to be protected in New Zealand
Report says disappearing life threatens biodiversity
California lead bullet ban moves forward
New Zealand's threatened species list updated
Remote New Zealand island evacuated as volcano erupts
Polar bears deliver environmental petition to Premier of British Columbia
Researchers: Wild gorillas seen using tools
Flaming possum blamed for New Zealand fire
Asian ministers pledge to increase wild tiger numbers
Iconic London mural could be restored
Short-tailed bats to be transferred to Kapiti Island, New Zealand
One day after attempted rescue, six stranded whales die on Australian beach
Scientists shocked at Great Barrier Reef bleaching
Australia's Simpson Desert to be closed for summer
Nobel Peace Prize awarded to Kenyan environmental activist
Modern technology maps new sections of the Great Wall of China
New species of dart frog discovered in Colombia
